titles: By the Council of State. A proclamation. The Council of State being informed, that since the officers of the armies under the Lord Generals Command, by their late humble remonstrance and address, declared their resolution to observe such commands as they shall receive from his excellency, or the Council of State, or the Parliament when assembled; ...
author: England and Wales. Council of State.
publisher: Printed by Abel Roper and Tho. Collins, Printors [sic] to the Council of State,
notes: Title from caption and first lines of text.
Dated at end: Fryday 13 Aprill, 1660. At the Council of State at VVhitehall.
"The army having expressed its obedience, certain persons have tried to disturb the soldiers with a report that the arrears would not be paid. This is untrue and malicious." -- Cf. Steele.
Reproductions of the originals in the Harvard University Library and the British Library.
keywords: England and Wales. --  Army --  Officers --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Commonwealth and Protectorate, 1649-1660 --  Early works to 1800.
